MAN.TITLE: imabsdiff
MAN.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: Calculate absolute difference of two images

PARAM_ITEM.PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Input images, which can be any kinds of images, but must have the same width, height and number of channels.
The absolute difference of two input images.

DESCRIPTION.P: imabsdiff calculate the absolute difference of two images. The two input images must have the same width, height and number of channels. If the two images have the same data type, the returned image will also has the same data type as input images. Otherwise, the two input images will be conerted to double first in the function.
Be careful that the elements in imout that exceed the range of the data type are truncated. Such as imabsdiff(int8(127),int8(-1)) will return -128.
